Multiple axillary LNS+ SURGICAL PATHOLOGY REPORT: Gross findings: a) Laterality : left breast                         Total dimensions: 23x16x6.5cm                         Skin ellipse: 18x6.5                         Tumor size: 5x4.8x3.5cm                         Margins of tumor: Infiltrating                         Deep margin: 2cm                         Adjacent breast: fibrotic                         Total number of nodes: 18                         Size of nodes: 0.5 to 4cm in diameter b) Left apical tissue: Received fibrofatty  soft tissue bits measuring 2x1.5x1cm. Dissection reveals that 1 lymphnode. Microscopic findings: Histologic type: Invasive ductal carcinoma, left breast Tumor has modified BR score of 6 of 9  (Grade II) Tubule formation                       <                      10%                 3 Nuclear pleomorphism  Moderate                                               2 Mitotic activity              4-5/10HPF                                             1                                                                                            -------                                                                                                 6                                                                                            ------- Other findings: Lymphnodes isolated    : 18                  involved: 8 Impression:             1.Invasive ductal carcinoma. Left breast             Tumor 5x4.8x3.5cm and has modified BR score of 6 of 9 (Grade II)             2.Resected margins are free from tumor             3.Lymphovascular emboli discerned             4.Metastatic deposits in eight of eighteen axillary lymphnodes. There is perinodal                  spread.             5.Reactive hyperplasia, apical node (0/1) ER/PR Status:             ER       : Positive             PR       : Positive Please advise me.Presently I underwent 2adjuvalent chemoes. and my third chemo falls on 26th November. Iam afraiding of my life. I had a very cute girl of 14 years. She is studying IX Class.
